Related Publication.Citation: Fungal volatiles can act as carbon sources and semiochemicals to mediate interspecific interactions among bark beetle-associated fungal symbionts

citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: Replication data for:  Jonathan A., Collignon, R. Maxwell, Klutsch, Jennifer G., Kanekar, Sanat S., Hussain, Altaf, and Erbilgin, Nadir. (2016) Fungal Volatiles Act as Carbon Sources and Semiochemicals to Mediate Interspecific Interactions Among Bark Beetle-Associated Fungal Symbionts. PLoS ONE. 11(9): e0162197. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0162197

ore:describes.Title: Replication data for: Fungal volatiles can act as carbon sources and semiochemicals to mediate interspecific interactions among bark beetle-associated fungal symbionts
ore:describes.schema:name: Replication data for: Fungal volatiles can act as carbon sources and semiochemicals to mediate interspecific interactions among bark beetle-associated fungal symbionts

ore:aggregates.schema:description: Fungal growth (culture area) and reproduction (conidia density) measurements for each culture used in the study's three experiments: concurrent, staggered, and carbon-restricted growth. Please refer to the ReadMe file for descriptions of dataset variables.
ore:aggregates.schema:name: Cale_et_al_Experiment_data.csv

ore:aggregates.schema:description: Concentrations for each headspace VOC detected from cultures of three mountain pine beetle (Dendroctonus ponderosae)-associated fungi: Grosmannia clavigera, Leptographium longiclavatum, and Ophiostoma montium. Please refer to the ReadMe file for descriptions of dataset variables.
ore:aggregates.schema:name: Cale_et_al_FVOC_profiles.csv

ore:aggregates.schema:description: Fungal growth (culture area) measurements for each culture in the carbon-restricted growth described in the Supporting Information. Please refer to the ReadMe file for descriptions of dataset variables.
ore:aggregates.schema:name: Cale_et_al_Supporting Data.csv
